Reviews.Title: “Bit of a rip off, Rude service”
Reviews.Author: ChanelInnamorata
Reviews.Content: Positives were cleanliness, large and spacious rooms & location. Negatives are no breakfast included in the already expensive room rate, nor was wi-fi included (had to pay â‚¬3/hour). Also, very cold & unhelpful staff. No positive vibes coming from them. When asked to have a double bed instead of 2 singles, got a sarcastic reception...and a blunt no.

Reviews.Title: “avoid”
Reviews.Author: David R
Reviews.Content: If you want to enjoy Venice, don't stay here. There is more space in the prison cells adjoining the Doge's Palace and the guards probably weren't as big a-holes as the staff!!!

Reviews.Title: “I love this place!”
Reviews.Author: pickygrrl
Reviews.Content: The value for this hotel is wonderful. I booked on the internet and didn't really know what to expect, but it was really fun. We got room A1, and I recommend it to anybody if you can get it. It is on the top floor of the palazzo, and it is definitely not for the week-kneed or faint-hearted, you have to climb up three floors, with your luggage, because the elevator only goes up to the second (first in Italy) floor. Once you're there, though, too cool. The room is a double-height ceiling, with an antique Murano chandelier, huge! Two windows looking out in two different directions on the canal, beautiful silk wall coverings and draperies. The bathroom, like so many in Venice, was minimal, to say the least, but it had it's own heater, paradise! Our room had it's own heater, too, controlled by the front desk, but it did work and we were cozy and warm which, given the nasty weather, was quite nice. Outside our room was a vast sitting area with windows and mirrors, looked like a museum. Breakfast room, tiny. Get there early or be prepared to wait, we never had to. Service and coffee were fine, or you could take a tray of breakfast up to your room. Staff spoke excellent English. Only knock: their WiFi basically doesn't work. Maybe that was a plus?

Reviews.Title: “Perfect On A Budget!”
Reviews.Author: Sweetpeaks
Reviews.Content: This hotel made our stay in Venice very relaxing and carefree. The location was perfect and central to everything. You can walk out the door and see gondolas on the canal. We got a standard king room and it was very spacious. The bathroom was huge! The room was also very clean. There is a school right next to the hotel so if you are trying get rest in the room during the day it's not going happen with all the kids screaming. The only negative thing was that there was no A/C when we visited. The front desk said it was because of the time of year. I would recommend getting lost in Venice. Just put the maps away and explore. I felt completely safe just wondering around. Also the hotel breakfast was good. They make custom hot drinks with pastries, cereal, and meats. Overall this hotel is perfect if you are on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Won't be back”
Reviews.Author: Bessie111
Reviews.Content: Whilst the room was beautiful the service was not. Having come from a 5star hotel in Florence that cost 50 euro less a night where they have excellent maid service where theynturn down ure bed, close the windows in the evening have a great reception and bar downstairs to come here was a real let down. There is a tiny box as a desk when u arrive the hotel was a mess with dirty laundry carts in the first floor lounge and bed linen drying on the chairs on the second it was definitely not first class. there was a sad looking mini bar with plastic cups the bathroom only had little sachets of shampoo and there was no welcome pamphlet or any of the nice stationary etc we got in Florence. You have to pay for wifi And in general not worth the money.everything is just a bit sloppy.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little cosi hotel”
Reviews.Author: bberica
Reviews.Content: The hotel was situated in a good location, very close to San Marco Square, with shops/resturants nearby. The room is clean but abit small, however we had this long corridor which we can put our luggages at, so it was generally very comfortable. The toilet is clean and good size of shower room, although the water pressure is quiet small. Overall I like this cosi hotel, the breakfast was limited but the staffs were helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Very good location”
Reviews.Author: MamaK186487
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my family earlier this month. The room easily accommodated four adults, the room was large and tidy. The bathroom was smaller and had only a shower in it. It was however clean and all that you would need. The rooms were cleaned thoroughly daily. The hotel is within easy walking distance of all the major sites and in an ideal location for any tourist visiting the city. My only complaint would be that the breakfast room is very small and we had on one occasion to wait before we could sit down for breakfast. The staff were helpful and efficient. Overall very good value for money. I would stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: pjrich57
Reviews.Content: Very pretty rooms that were clean and air-conditioned. Staff was very friendly and spoke English. Lovely sitting rooms. Good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice very romantic”
Reviews.Author: lornakerry
Reviews.Content: What a splendid old style hotel.. a dream to get too walking through all the little side streets and the view from our suite was amazing over looking the little canals. does not look much on the outside but the room was huge and beautifully decorated. we had breakfast in bed and it was all right nothing special. our champagne that my boyfriend had ordered when booking arrived ten mins after our arrival. its a fantastic place and it is in a perfect position for sightseeing....

Reviews.Title: “Can recommend”
Reviews.Author: FerrisXL
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel for 3 nights and can recommend it. The location, beautiful decor, helpful english-speaking staff and the good price-quality ratio all make it a place to recommend. The breakfast situation, as mentioned in the previous review, is not ideal and could be improved as the room is really small and there are few tables, however we never had to wait really long for a table. In light of all the pluses this hotel has to offer, we don't consider this a reason strong enough for not recommending the hotel. We would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible breakfast situation”
Reviews.Author: Karimcool
Reviews.Content: I was in venice during the carnival. The hotel was ideally located from St. Marks Square, and the room was great. The hotel has two impressive old antique rooms, which are common areas, but with no real usage to the traveller. There is an nice breakfast served but the location could not be worse. Next to the lobby are four tables and at any given time we were coming and had to wait or being stared at from other travellers to wait for a seat to open up. Its really not understandable why a owner would create such a felt like 5 sq m breakfast area, where such great old impressive rooms are left to no usage at all. I asked the reception and the answer why such a decision was made was: because we do not have a kitchen there. Coming myself fom the hotel business this seems a lame excuse, italian breakfast includes an hot beverage and croissants, no egg dish has to be prepared, and even though no kitchen is available, enough tableware and coffee could be provided. Under the current circumstances I can not recommend to stay there, or only if you give the breakfast a miss.

Reviews.Title: “This is truly an elegant hotel”
Reviews.Author: Barbara60763
Reviews.Content: As you enter the Corte dei Greci you notice the plush red carpeting on the staircase. This is truly an elegant hotel. Our room was beautifully decorated and so was the adjoining sitting room. The bathroom was immaculate and had a great shower. The staff spoke english and were very helpful in answering any and all questions we had. It was nice that breakfast was included in the price of the hotel. Highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Venice.

Reviews.Title: “lovely”
Reviews.Author: CapitanaD
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room A1 at the Corte dei Greci. This is large corner room has views of the canal below, beautiful furnishings and an even larger sitting room (common area) outside the door. The breakfast room was on the small side, but breakfast was very nice: Coffee, 2 cereals, 2 juices, ham, cheese, croissants and rolls, butter and jam. Finding this hotel is not difficult if you follow the directions. It is easy walking distance from the San Zaccharia vaporetto stop with only 2 bridges with steps to manage with luggage. It is also very close to St Marks Square. Reception is not manned 24 hour/day. Ring the bell at night and the door is answered quickly.

Reviews.Title: “Servents room anyone!”
Reviews.Author: M0i1
Reviews.Content: Wow, what a romantic stay in Venice!! On checking in to our hotel we were directed to our room. This was the only room on the ground floor. We were brought through the small breakfast room , throught the Breakfast room toilet and into our room at the back of the hotel. The room itself was large, but had a dank damp smell. We can't understand why this was a guest room at all, especially as when we went to leave for dinner (when we had to treck around the hotel looking for the security! man to let us out) and got to see upstairs where every other guest was staying. We didn't see inside the rooms, but they didn't look like survents quaters to us! Each morning we could head the breakfast room being made ready and then the other guests arrive. Some we had to listen going to using the toilet. Lovely wake up call! We did ask to be moved as soon as we say where the room was but we were told it was fully occupied, but they would get back to us on moving us the following morning. NO chance. Each morning we felt like we had come from the servents quaters and toilet to get to the breakfast room, where other guests looked at us in amazment.. Do all online bookings get this treatment!!

Reviews.Title: “nice rooms, great location, very near to vaporetto and st. markus square”
Reviews.Author: wuifi
Reviews.Content: Does not look special from outside but rooms are very nice and big. Only the small Breakfast room was a down turn. Also the price for the rooms are quite expensive, but I guess this is normal when you want to stay in the heart of Venice. Location is within walking distance of Markus Square and Vaporetto. Overall it was a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with great location and value for money.”
Reviews.Author: QuirkyTraveller
Reviews.Content: Likes: - Great hotel with value for money. - Spacious room. Clean. Beautiful venetian chandelier adorned the room. - Bathroom was clean though tiny (as expected). - Great location, walking distance to Piazza San Marco (about 5 mins stroll) - Several nearby restaurants (located on the same alley) - Breakfast room was rather small but cosy. Breakfast was simple (ham and salami, croissant, toast, cheese and coffee/cappucino) Go down for breakfast early to avoid the queue, or else you might end up waiting in queue for 1/2hr. - Service was great. The receptionist was really helpful and friendly. Dislikes: - No elevator. Fret not cause there was a bellhop who would help to bring the luggage up using the service elevator. Unfortunately, upon check-out the elevator was out-of-order and the bellhop was unavailable. So you could imagine the pain of lugging the luggage down 3 flights of stairs. In summary, it is a great hotel and I would definitely stay here the next time I'm in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: rikiks
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from Venice and stayed at Corte dei Greci hotel for 3 nights. The location is absolutely great, really near St Marco, restaurants, shops and Vaporetto station but in a quiet canal so you can really rest at night. We booked a JR suite which was a huge room with a private terrace (the only one in the hotel) where we had our breakfasts which were good (room service suplement 5 euros but it really worths it) ....just great to wake up in the morning and enjoying the sun on the terrace. The hotel was very clean and charming, staff has been very helpful and kind at all times and the hotel offers a private navette to Murano! A great hotel and a great weekend!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, very clean, lovely bed and room, breakfast experience not so wonderful”
Reviews.Author: MrGilbus
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights here. We were delighted with the room and the location. Our superior double room overlooked a small canal. St Mark's square was only 4 minute walk away yet we felt as though we were away from the crowds. Room was beautifully clean, huge comfortable bed, lovely spacious shower room en-suite. Breakfast room is ridiculously small and the quality was quite poor but this didn't spoil our stay one bit and we would thoroughly recommend staying here for the comfort, location and easy access to everywhere you'd want to get to easily.

Reviews.Title: “it was lovely”
Reviews.Author: pinkporto
Reviews.Content: easy to get there, friendly and helpfull staff, nice room(small), very clean(!), breakfast was ok, great location,the air conditioning was a little bit noisy. I certainly would recomend this hotel to those people who want a nice,cozy, quiet vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular Room and Ideal Location”
Reviews.Author: RLevey
Reviews.Content: We were traveling with our seven year olds and booked this hotel after reading positive reviews and getting a great rate on venere.com. It couldn't have been easier to get to, right at the same vaporetto stop as the Danielli. An ideal location, short walk to San Marco and most of the sights. The room was spectacular, enormous with two twin beds, a king bed and still a ton of room, plus an amazing deck with a full dining table. The AC worked great even in the July heat. The breakfast was fine, though the dining room is small and we had to wait, but no big deal. They were super sweet to our daughters too. Highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, but nothing more than satisfactory inside”
Reviews.Author: Jesse1551
Reviews.Content: This unassuming hotel has the location, with St Marks about 5 minutes stroll away. It's not too difficult to find if you have the street number â€“ so keep it to hand when you arrive. My room also had the added bonus of a balcony overlooking the inner courtyard. On the negative side, the walls were thin. I could hear people arrive and leave, talking with the receptionist and alarm clocks going off â€“ all of which were quite annoying. Breakfast was of a lower than average standard, with two types of cereal, two types of meat, cheese, yoghurt, pre-packed snacks, small bread rolls and croissants the only things available. Plus breakfast was served in a cramped dining room containing five tables only large enough for two. I felt sorry for the lady serving the day the whole hotel seemed to come for breakfast at the same time, as she ended up serving people in their rooms. Even the amount of bread was sporadic, as one day I received two rolls and a croissant, the next was two rolls and two croissants, and the final day was one roll and one croissant. Another annoying system is that you have to leave your key with the front desk each time you leave, which is fine, but it will only work if there is someone at the desk! On numerous occasions I went down to find people ambling about the lobby not knowing what to do. Overall; great location, just don't expect anything special. Likes Location Some of the staff were really helpful Dislikes Thin walls Paying (so much!) for the internet â€“ 5 Euros per hour Breakfast

Reviews.Title: “A super location in this great city”
Reviews.Author: peidmonte
Reviews.Content: Easy to find (print off the details on their website), very handy for Saint Mark's Square and many great restaurants and bars, but not noisy. Set on a lovely canal, if you're lucky you'll have great views of the canal and the gondaliers preparing their gondalas in the morning. Breakfast in the small breakfast room is satisfactory.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: Dennisht
Reviews.Content: The only problem with this hotel is finding it! Grafitti on exterior walls and no name/sign, just the address number. The door was open abit and we stuck our head in and asked if this was the hotel and yes it was. Great location just a nice stroll to St. Mark's Square. Hotel was just opened a few weeks before we arrived. Very clean, very nice rooms and great bathroom, everything very modern, Euro style. Great air conditioning too. Staff was very helpful and friendly. Breakfast fell short of what we expected, they can improve on this with little trouble. Ours was delivered to our room, nice touch. Room was quiet but figuring out how to operate the TV and the very modern remotely controled air conditioning was a real challenge. All in all a very good experience and a very enjoyable one night stay. Close to good food and all the sights. Stay here, you will not be disappointed, we would go back in a minute. Ah, wish I was there right now!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel No Name”
Reviews.Author: bunny19
Reviews.Content: This is a recently opened hotel with traditional Venetian dÃ©cor. We had booked a â€˜superiorâ€™ room, which was well worth the extra cost for the space and view, and represented value for money. There was highly efficient air-conditioning which permitted sleep at the front of the building where some motorised boats pass. The shower room was smaller than those pictured on various websites, but modern and certainly adequate, with usual toiletries provided. Donâ€™t bother bringing a hairdryer, as they are efficient here. The 2nd floor was spacious with a huge lounge area, as on the first floor, the latter overlooking the canal. The staff are friendly, helpful and can communicate well in English. Ask for a map on arrival to navigate round the city more quickly. Check-in and check-out were prompt and efficient. Breakfast was adequate, but Iâ€™ve had better at similarly-priced hotels in Venice: rolls, croissants, biscotti, cereal (choice of 2), juice and yoghurt and excellent cappuccino. A couple of extra Euros on the cost to improve the breakfast would make this hotel even more attractive. The breakfast room itself is really a corridor, leading to one of the guest rooms, and seats only 10 people, so we had a few minutesâ€™ wait one morning, but have experienced this in other Venetian hotels. One website description that it overlooks â€˜the private internal courtyardâ€™ is best ignored. Thereâ€™s no view while at breakfast. The main concern is that from the 2nd floor, where the larger rooms are, there are no emergency exit signs (or any from 2nd to 1st floor) to the ground floor, and itâ€™s a bit of a maze. This needs to be addressed immediately. Getting to the hotel should be very easy, but the front is covered in graffiti and there is no hotel name on it at all! Donâ€™t let this worry you on arrival. It in no way indicates the quality inside. Follow the instructions given, then use the building number (above the door). It really is only about 60m along the canal. If you get to the Ponte dei Greci, youâ€™ve missed it, so turn back! Itâ€™s a great location, very close to San Zaccaria water bus stop from which is a main one, so very convenient. There are no bridges between the water bus from Piazzale Roma to the hotel and itâ€™s a flat walk. Make sure you go into the San Zaccaria church and pay the â‚¬1 to go into the crypt, which floods from time to time. Local restaurants and even roughish looking snack bars are expensive, even by Venice standards. You can get cheaper not much further away. Despite the observations above, this is a clean and highly recommended hotel.

HotelInfo.Name: Corte Dei Greci Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Castello 4973, 30122 Venice, Italy
